verses.verse: And Abraham <S%H85><s%> journeyed <S%H5265><s%> from thence toward the land <S%H776><s%> of the South <S%H5045><s%>, and dwelt <S%H3427><s%> between Kadesh <S%H6946><s%> and Shur <S%H7793><s%>; and he sojourned <S%H1481><s%> in Gerar <S%H1642><s%>.

And Abraham <S%H85><s%> said <S%H559><s%> of <S%H413><s%> Sarah <S%H8283><s%> his wife <S%H802><s%>, She is my sister <S%H269><s%>: and Abimelech <S%H40><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Gerar <S%H1642><s%> sent <S%H7971><s%>, and took <S%H3947><s%> Sarah <S%H8283><s%>.

But God <S%H430><s%> came <S%H935><s%> to Abimelech <S%H40><s%> in a dream <S%H2472><s%> of the night <S%H3915><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%> to him <S%H4191><s%>, Behold, thou art but a dead man, because of the woman <S%H802><s%> whom thou hast taken <S%H3947><s%>; for she is a man <S%H1167><s%>'s wife <S%H1166><s%>.
Now Abimelech <S%H40><s%> had not come near <S%H7126><s%> her <S%H559><s%>: and he said, Lord <S%H136><s%>, wilt thou slay <S%H2026><s%> even a righteous <S%H6662><s%> nation <S%H1471><s%>?

Said <S%H559><s%> he not himself unto me <S%H1931><s%>, She is my sister <S%H269><s%>? and she <S%H1931><s%>, even <S%H1571><s%> she <S%H1931><s%> herself said <S%H559><s%>, He is my brother <S%H251><s%>: in the integrity <S%H8537><s%> of my heart <S%H3824><s%> and the innocency <S%H5356><s%> of my hands <S%H3709><s%> have I done this <S%H6213><s%>.

And God <S%H430><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto him in the dream <S%H2472><s%>, Yea <S%H1571><s%>, I know <S%H3045><s%> that in the integrity <S%H8537><s%> of thy heart <S%H3824><s%> thou has done <S%H6213><s%> this <S%H2820><s%>, and I also withheld thee from sinning <S%H2398><s%> against me <S%H5414><s%>: therefore suffered I thee not to touch her <S%H5060><s%>.

Now therefore restore <S%H7725><s%> the man <S%H376><s%>'s wife <S%H802><s%>; for he is a prophet <S%H5030><s%>, and he shall pray <S%H6419><s%> for thee <S%H1157><s%>, and thou shalt live <S%H2421><s%>: and if thou restore <S%H7725><s%> her not <S%H3045><s%>, know thou that thou shalt surely <S%H4191><s%> die <S%H4191><s%>, thou, and all that are thine.

And Abimelech <S%H40><s%> rose early <S%H7925><s%> in the morning <S%H1242><s%>, and called <S%H7121><s%> all his servants <S%H5650><s%>, and told <S%H1696><s%> all these things <S%H1697><s%> in their ears <S%H241><s%>: and the men <S%H582><s%> were sore <S%H3966><s%> afraid <S%H3372><s%>.

Then Abimelech <S%H40><s%> called <S%H7121><s%> Abraham <S%H85><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H6213><s%>, What hast thou done unto us <S%H2398><s%>? and wherein have I sinned against thee <S%H935><s%>, that thou hast brought on me and on my kingdom <S%H4467><s%> a great <S%H1419><s%> sin <S%H2401><s%>? thou hast done <S%H6213><s%> deeds <S%H4639><s%> unto me that ought not to be done <S%H6213><s%>.
And Abimelech <S%H40><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto Abraham <S%H85><s%>, What <S%H4100><s%> sawest thou <S%H7200><s%>, that thou hast done <S%H6213><s%> this thing <S%H1697><s%>?

And Abraham <S%H85><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, Because I thought <S%H559><s%>, Surely <S%H7535><s%> the fear <S%H3374><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> is not in this place <S%H4725><s%>; and they will slay me <S%H2026><s%> for my wife <S%H802><s%>'s sake <S%H1697><s%>.

And moreover she is indeed <S%H546><s%> my sister <S%H269><s%>, the daughter <S%H1323><s%> of my father <S%H1><s%>, but not the daughter <S%H1323><s%> of my mother <S%H517><s%>; and she became my wife <S%H802><s%>:

and it came to pass <S%H430><s%>, when God caused me to wander <S%H8582><s%> from my father <S%H1><s%>'s house <S%H1004><s%>, that I said <S%H559><s%> unto her <S%H2617><s%>, This is thy kindness which thou shalt show <S%H6213><s%> unto me <S%H4725><s%>: at every place whither we shall come <S%H935><s%>, say <S%H559><s%> of me <S%H251><s%>, He is my brother.

And Abimelech <S%H40><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> sheep <S%H6629><s%> and oxen <S%H1241><s%>, and men-servants <S%H5650><s%> and women-servants <S%H8198><s%>, and gave <S%H5414><s%> them unto Abraham <S%H85><s%>, and restored <S%H7725><s%> him Sarah <S%H8283><s%> his wife <S%H802><s%>.
And Abimelech <S%H40><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, Behold <S%H776><s%>, my land is before thee <S%H3427><s%>: dwell where it pleaseth thee <S%H2896><s%>.

And unto Sarah <S%H8283><s%> he said <S%H559><s%>, Behold <S%H5414><s%>, I have given thy brother <S%H251><s%> a thousand <S%H505><s%> pieces of silver <S%H3701><s%>: behold <S%H3682><s%>, it is for thee a covering of the eyes <S%H5869><s%> to all that are with thee <S%H3198><s%>; and in respect of all thou art righted.

And Abraham <S%H85><s%> prayed <S%H6419><s%> unto God <S%H430><s%>: and God <S%H430><s%> healed <S%H7495><s%> Abimelech <S%H40><s%>, and his wife <S%H802><s%>, and his maid-servants <S%H519><s%>; and they bare children <S%H3205><s%>.

For Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> had fast <S%H6113><s%> closed up <S%H6113><s%> all the wombs <S%H7358><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%> of Abimelech <S%H40><s%>, because <S%H1697><s%> of Sarah <S%H8283><s%>, Abraham <S%H85><s%>'s wife <S%H802><s%>.
